passages.text: August 29, 2025 07:05 PM GMT
WHAT'S CHANGEDBYD Company Limited (002594.SZ)FromToPrice TargetRmb144.00Rmb136.00BYD Company Limited (1211.HK)Price TargetHK$146.00HK$137.00
Unchanged Impact to our thesis
Source: Company data, Morgan Stanley Research

2Q results were below our expectations and consensus with a substantial miss on GPM at \(16.3\%\) , the lowest since 2Q22 despite \(3.4x\) the volume. The growth outlook remains bounded by China's uncertainties and global opportunities. A lack of predictability could pinch the stock price near-term.

- BYD reported 2Q25 earnings of Rmb6.4bn (-30% YoY and -31% QoQ), below market expectations and MSe of Rmb10bn.- Excluding Rmb1.1bn profit contribution from BYDE, BYD's vehicle unit profit was Rmb4.8k in 2Q (vs. Rmb8.8k in 1Q25), the lowest quarterly level since 1Q22.- Revenue grew 18% QoQ to 14% YoY to Rmb201bn in 2Q, while deliveries grew 14% QoQ, implying a 3% QoQ ASP expansion.- GPM fell 3.8ppt QoQ to 16.3% in 2Q, likely dragged down by dealer rebates, BoM cost increase, and price cuts in May.

2Q results were disappointing - much lower GpM (- 3.8ppt QoQ) was the key culprit: Fall- year consensus estimates may fall accordingly in terms of both growth and probability. We're inclined to attribute the miss to: 1) Rmb666 dealer rebates perbar for almost all 1.7mn cars sold in China during 1H25; 2) BoM cost hike from "God's Eye" smart driving system yet inferior volume increment; and 3) further price cuts from late April. That said, the missing benefits from higher mix of overseas sales, moderate FX benefits (particularly from sales to Europe), and scale in 2Q still come as a surprise and make us wonder whether there are any one- off or kitchen- sinking factors in play that make 2Q a deep margin trough with more aggressive cost reduction kicking in from 3Q.
MORGAN STANLEY ASIA LIMITED+
Tim Hsiao Equity Analyst
BYD Company Limited (1211.HK, 1211 HK)
China Autos & Shared Mobility | China

Stock Rating Industry ViewOverweight In-LinePrice targetHK$137.00Up/downside to price target (%)20Shr price, close (Aug 29, 2025)HK$114.4052-Week RangeHK$159.27-72.33Sh out, dil, curr (mn)4,364Mkt cap, curr (mn)Rmb953,320EV, curr (mn)Rmb907,263Avg daily trading value (mn)HK$4,153

Morgan Stanley does and seeks to do business with companies covered in Morgan Stanley Research. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of Morgan Stanley Research. Investors should consider Morgan Stanley Research as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

\(+ =\) Analysts employed by non-U.S. affiliates are not registered with FINRA, may not be associated persons of the member and may not be subject to FINRA restrictions on communications with a subject company, public appearances and trading securities held by a research analyst account.

We don't see the 2Q miss meaningfully altering the narrative of BYD's expanding global reach, especially given the company's new car registrations across Europe tripled YoY in the past month, continually outselling Tesla. However, without an earnings briefing, both the results and near- term outlook remain lacking in detail and stay uncertain - providing credence to market bears until more company updates are available in the following days. The next catalysts could be a seasonal sales uptick, debut of over 8'26 facelifts around Chengdu Auto Show (8/29- 9/7), and an overseas resurgence that can soothe global investors' nerves.

Valuation. At the latest close of HK\$114, the stock trades at 20x 12- month forward P/E based on our estimates - not demanding but not cheap. We look for a knee- jerk sell- off led by HK/China investors after the anemic 2Q print, which may undermine near- term stock performance. The H- share price has corrected 27% from its peak but remains up 29% YTD (vs. +25% for the Hang Seng Index). We believe the tug- of- war between local bears and global bulls will continue.

Stay Ow - our new probability- weighted DCF- based price targets are HK\$137/Rmb136: They reflect our reduction in gross margin and deliveries forecasts for 2025- 27. That said, we still see long- term strategic value in BYD's global presence as well as global potential, though we harbor worries over short- term demand, profitability, and an unfavorable policy backdrop. We keep monitoring a broad range of macro- micro cross- currents that could keep influencing the near- term volatility of BYD's stock price beyond the 2Q print.

Deliveries: We cut our 2025- 27 wholesale estimates by 7%/9%/10% to 5.0/5.6/6.2mn units, respectively. Our forecasts implies an average 470- 480k monthly run rate in 2H, reflecting seasonality and several facelifts launched around the Chengdu Auto Show. We look for overseas sales to arrive at 1- 1.1mn units this year.

Gross margin: We have taken down our full year gross margin forecast significantly to 19.3% from 20.9% previously. We note that for many years, BYD has aimed to sustain gross margin of 20- 25% in a steady- state, but this quarter seems to show an exception against the anti- evolution backdrop in China, which we believe may send out a signal to the authorities of policy risk.

Net income: Our full- year 2025 net income estimate falls to Rmb45bn from Rmb52bn previously. Our forecast implies Rmb8- 8.2k unit profit from Rmb9.2k previously. Our assumption reflects a more meaningful resurgence in unit profit in 2H, calling for a more meaningful seasonal uptick in overall volume scale, new model mix and, to a greater extent, overseas sales. Our net profit estimates for 2026 and 2027 are lowered by 13%/12% to Rmb56/68bn, respectively. Our EPS estimates for 2025- 27 go down by the same magnitude as the net profit revisions.
Exhibit 1: BYD: Estimate revisions

We continue to use a probability- weighted methodology to value BYD. We apply unchanged probability weightings of \(25\%\) , \(50\%\) , and \(25\%\) to our bull, base, and bear case scenarios, in line with what we use for its EV start- up peers.

This implies 21x 2026e P/E. We maintain our WACC of \(14.3\%\) , based on \(8\%\) equity risk premium, 1.8 beta, \(4\%\) risk- free rate, and \(3\%\) long- term growth. Our lower base case value reflects our lower 2025- 27 earnings estimates.
This implies 30x bull case 2026e P/E. We continue to use a SOTP (sum- of- the- parts) valuation methodology. There are three main parts:
BYD's whole EV business \(- 2x\) EV/sales (unchanged): benchmarked against EV startups;
BYD's battery business \(- 7x\) EV/EBITDA (unchanged): benchmarked against CATL; and
BYDE - we use its most recent closing market cap.
This is based on 12x 2026e bear case P/E.

In this scenario, we assume worse- than- expected auto sales both domestically and overseas as several emerging markets enter economic recessions, while BYD cuts prices more aggressively from fiercer EV competition. We factor in minimum external battery sales and lower auto sales volume.
Reflecting the changes to our estimates and scenario values above, our BYD- H price target edges down to HK\$137 (from HK\$146), implying 21x 2026e P/E.

Our price target for BYD- A decreases by a similar magnitude, to Rmb136 (from Rmb144). For BYD- A, we continue to apply a \(5\%\) premium to our H- share bull and base case values, and no premium to our bear case value. We apply an exchange rate of 1.06 RMB/HKD (unchanged).
Therefore, we make the following changes:
- Base case Rmb135 (from Rmb149), implying 22x 2026E P/E.- Bull case Rmb216 (unchanged), implying 30x bull case 2026E P/E.- Bear case Rmb57 (from Rmb63), implying 12x 2026E bear case P/E.
Our price target for BYD- A implies 22x 2026E P/E.
Exhibit 3: BYD: DCF Model - Base Case
Source: Company Data, Morgan Stanley Research. E = Morgan Stanley Research Estimates
Global EV bellwether with smart driving and global ambitions

OVERWEIGHT THESIS- We expect BYD to enjoy greater advantages in cost competition and bargaining power with the supply chain vs. other Chinese OEMs, given its vertically integrated supply chain and growing scale.- BYD's PHEV offerings could be highly price- competitive in emerging markets where charging infrastructure is undeveloped, while it could help bypass EV tariffs in developed markets.- We think BYD's efforts to democratize ADAS in the mass market segment could eventually transform BYD into a smart driving technology enabler.- If we apply Chinese peers' standard of capitalizing R&D by \(\sim 50\%\) vs. BYD's \(\sim 2\%\) , the stock would be trading at \(\sim 12x\) P/E, which looks attractive for an industry bellwether.
Source: Refinitiv, Morgan Stanley Research
Risk Reward ThemesDisruption: NegativeElectric Vehicles: PositivePricing Power: PositiveView descriptions of Risk Rewards Themes here

Emerging autonomous driving technology enabler + rapid global expansion: Our SOTP- based bull- case value is mainly to benchmark: 1) BYD's whole EV business with that of leading EV startups; 2) BYD's battery business with CATL; and 3) BYDE with its recent closing market cap.

Solid operational resilience with scale: We use DCF to derive our base- case valuation. We factor in \(15\% +\) volume growth in 2025 and a \(20\% +\) earnings CAGR from 2025- 27. We expect mild rises in ASP and unit profit, with a higher proportion of overseas and premium sales offsetting ongoing price pressure in the mass market.

Worse- than- expected auto sales and EV battery business: We assume worse- than- expected auto sales both domestically and overseas as several emerging markets enter economic recession, while BYD cuts prices more aggressively in response to fiercer EV competition. We factor in minimum external battery sales and lower auto sales volume.

Global EV bellwether with smart driving and global ambitions

We expect BYD to enjoy greater advantages in cost competition and bargaining power with the supply chain vs. other Chinese OEMs, given its vertically integrated supply chain and growing scale. BYD's PHEV offerings could be highly price- competitive in emerging markets where charging infrastructure is undeveloped, while it could help bypass EV tariffs in developed markets. We think BYD's efforts to democratize ADAS in the mass market segment could eventually transform BYD into a smart driving technology enabler. If we apply Chinese peers' standard of capitalizing R&D by \(- 50\%\) vs. BYD's \(\sim 2\%\) the stock would be trading at \(\sim 12x\) P/E, which looks attractive for an industry bellwether.
Consensus Rating Distribution

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12- 18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

In- Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12- 18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below. Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12- 18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below. Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI sub- regional index or MSCI AC Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.
